title.narrative: Water And Sanitation Improvement In Informal Settlements Through Gender Mainstreaming And Empowerment Of Local Authority

description.narrative:
The goal of the project is to improve health and sanitation within the informal settlement and empower women within the decision mechanisms at community level.
The overall objective of this project is to provide safe drinking water and sanitation facilities in selected informal settlements by gender mainstreaming and empowering local authority to improve public health and sanitation.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

title.narrative: Improved policy dialogue and design for increasing access to basic services at local and national levels

description.narrative: Improved policy dialogue and design for increasing access to basic services at local and national levels

title.narrative: Issues related to women's access to water and sanitation of the urban poor in informal settlements documented

title.narrative: local people and municipal authorities received comprehensive training on different aspect of water, sanitation & hygiene sector who will act as master trainers

title.narrative: issues related to women’s access to water in informal settlements identified and addressed

title.narrative: improved the capacities of the local authority to provide access to water for women in informal settlements, and to empower women in the decision-making process through gender responsive community based approaches

target.value: At least 30 local people and municipal authorities received comprehensive training on different aspect of water, sanitation & hygiene sector who will act as master trainers
